titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Richard Williamson Ellis (1894-1982) was a typographer, book designer, and printer. His works include fine art editions of Candide, Heart of Darkness, The Pennsylvania German Fraktur of the Free Library of Philadelphia, and The Four Gospels and the Acts of the Apostles.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Frank Harrington's papers on Richard W. Ellis. Materials include samples of Ellis's printing and designs, clippings and articles on his work, correspondence regarding a 1977 exhibition, announcements, and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Special Collections Department, Temple University: Papers of Richard Williamson Ellis.
